The NRL's cardboard cutout fan initiative has been mostly fun and games, but someone slipped in a dark gag.

articles.title: Newcastle Knights and Penrith Panthers play out 14-14 draw after Mitchell Pearce, Connor Watson injured - ABC News
articles.description: Newcastle lost halfback Mitchell Pearce and hooker Connor Watson in the first seven minutes and trailed 14-0, before rookies stepped up to help the team eke out a draw against Penrith.
articles.content:
Rookie hooker Chris Randall has broken a record for the most tackles on debut as the Newcastle Knights relied on their freshest faces to save them in a 14-14 draw against Penrith.
<ul><li>Mitchell P… [+2569 chars]

articles.author: Scott Pryde
articles.title: Seven talking points from NRL Round 3 - The Roar
articles.description: The NRL is back, with Round 3 in the books after a nine-week lay-off. There were rule changes, referee changes, a contender claiming their first points, another Green Machine raid to Victoria and some clubs playing dreadful footy. There is plenty to wrap up, …

articles.title: Brisbane Bombers confident they can become the fourth Queensland-based team in the NRL - ABC News
articles.description: The Brisbane Bombers bid team have been trying to get into the NRL for a decade — now with plans announced for a new Queensland team in 2022 or 2023, they are confident they can get there.
articles.content:
The Brisbane Bombers bid team say the proven ability of Peter V'landys to get things done leaves them confident the NRL will introduce a 17th club to the competition by 2023.
